RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 14 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STAR FINALITY away well and dueled for the lead from the outside of C C SUNRISE entering the first turn, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch, took a narrow advantage into the final turn, and held a determined ISLAND LIVING off following a stretch long battle to prevail. ISLAND LIVING away alertly and tracked the leaders into the backstretch while racing just out from the rail, launched her bid three wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly four wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. C C SUNRISE broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside, struggled to match strides with her pace rival entering the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive to prove best of the rest. SILVER ARROW stalked the early pacesetters while saving ground rail entering the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response while finishing three wide in the drive. VISENYA unhurried early while dropping back to trail, was always well back, and failed to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: C C Sunrise
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Island Living
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Arrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Visenya
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Star Finality
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2 wide, led, held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 14 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since August 14 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $62 5 To $5,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BELLAROO broke sharply and tracked the leaders from along the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied smartly three wide entering the final turn, and closed determinedly four wide in the drive to get up in the final strides to get the better of a stubborn RICHARDS COMMAND. RICHARDS COMMAND tracked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly two wide entering the final turn, held the narrowest of advantages into the lane, and just failed to last, in a game effort. ANIMA dueled for the lead from the outside of ANAAMY entering the first turn, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch, overtook her pace rival approaching the final turn, but was no match for the top two in the late stages. ZETAMARIE unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and finished two wide in the drive while unable to mount a serious late bid. ANAAMY away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the backstretch, was overtaken nearing the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Bellaroo
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked rail, rallied 3w, closed 4w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Anaamy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Zetamarie
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson, Gary C., Pumpkin Stable and Sharlea Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Anima
ENTRY.OWNER: Bulldog Bros Racing and LeMasurier Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Richards Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, nipped

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 14 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming P rice $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NINE OCLOCK CEASER away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of DRILL BABY DRILL in the run down the backstretch, continued to battle with her pace rival through the final turn and into the lane, and prevailed over that rival in the closing strides while racing one out from the rail. DRILL BABY DRILL broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the backstretch, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside and through the final turn, held the narrowest of advantages into the lane, and just failed to last. TEXAS LEGACY unhurried early while trailing the field in the run down the backstretch, commenced her bid three wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly four wide in the drive to get up for a share while gaining ground late. PERFECT PENNY tracked the dueling leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly two wide through the final turn, and closed willingly three wide from between rivals in deep stretch. PENALTY TO RANGERS away well and tracked the leaders in the run down the backside while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide through the final turn, drifted to the middle of the track leaving the turn, and was unable to pose a late threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Drill Baby Drill
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied inside, closed rail, nipped

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Penny
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Nine Oclock Ceaser
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Legacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Penalty to Rangers
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 3 wide, rallied 3wide, bore out 1/8

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 14 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $ 3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ARIKARA broke sharply and raced to the lead while one out from the rail entering the backstretch, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, held a clear advantage into the lane, but was all out to fend off a late surge by HARLAN'S ANGEL to prevail. HARLAN'S ANGEL away alertly and pressed the leader three wide in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, was unable to match strides with her pace rival leaving the turn and entering the lane, but closed with late interest four wide in deep stretch to just miss. ROSE OF TEXAS tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and closed willingly from along the rail in the drive in a solid effort. AMANDA hopped at the start to get away a step slow, settled at the back of a compact field in the run down the backside, commenced her bid from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed steadily two wide from between rivals in deep stretch to just miss. TEXAS HUMOR away well and tracked the leaders in the run down the backside, struggled to maintain her position while racing three wide into the final turn, but faded over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Rose of Texas
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Humor
ENTRY.OWNER: GO Stables and Ramirez Alexa Danae
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Amanda
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped, settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Harlan's Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Arikara
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led 2w, rallied inside, closed 3 wide, held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Glen Todd Fantasy S. HASTINGS RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 67. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR TWO-YEAR-OLD FILLIES. By payment of $100 nomination by midnight Saturday October 7, 2023 with $750 to enter and an additional $1,000 to start. $50,000 guaranteed of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fif th, and 2% sixth through eighth, finishers nineth through twelfth will receive their starter fee back. Preference will be based upon the rules outlined in the Hastings condition book at the time of entry. Weight: 122 lbs. Field will be limited to 12 star ters.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BROOKE MAGIC stalked the leaders while saving ground along the inside through the stretch the first turn, pulled his way into a tracking trip in the run down the backside, rallied from along the rail entering the final turn, slipped through at the rail entering the lane, and quickly assumed command and drew clear late. LIZZIE'S RAYNE away alertly and pressed the pace two wide through the stretch the first time, continued to force the issue from the outside of VIVA LA DIVA in the run down the backside, rallied two wide through the final turn, and closed three wide in the drive to get the better of her pace rival for the place in the final strides. VIVA LA DIVA away well and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside and into the final turn, led the filed leaving the turn, was overtaken from along the inside by BROOKE MAGIC entering the lane, and just failed to hold the place. ACOUSTIC MELODY settled off the early pace while racing three wide entering the stretch the first time, gained ground on the leaders in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide through the final turn, and finished evenly four wide in the drive. EDDIE'S GIRL broke sharply and was taken in hand and allowed to settle off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the stretch the first time, rallied three wide from the back of the pack entering the final turn, but failed to mount a serious late bid when called upon. LONIE MO bore out entering the first turn , and raced extremely wide while being chased into a stalking trip through the stretch the first time, bore out again entering the second turn while racing towards the outside fence, was pulled up with the assistance of an outrider in the run down the backstretch, and walked off under her own power following the race. SKYSABLAZING unhurried early while trailing the field through the stretch the first time while saving ground along the inside, sustained an injury midway down the backstretch and was pulled up, and vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Skysablazing
ENTRY.OWNER: Emlyn Brian Kiehlbauch Laura Little Glen Conley Bruce and Unwin Bruce
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, injured, vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Brooke Magic
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, tracked rail, rallied rail, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Viva La Diva
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Lonie Mo
ENTRY.COMMENT: bore out early, pulled up, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Eddie's Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Lizzie's Rayne
ENTRY.OWNER: Renfrew Racing B and B Racing Breen Racing Chan Eugene and Milburn Dave
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed 2w, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Acoustic Melody
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Glen Todd Ascot Graduation S. HASTINGS RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 75. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR TWO-YEAR-OLDS. By payment of $100 nomination by midnight Saturday October 7, 2023 with $750 to enter and an additional $1,000 to start. $50,000 guaranteed of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, an d 2% sixth through eighth, finishers nineth through twelfth will receive their starter fee back. The race will not be divided. Preference will be based upon the rules outlined in the Hastings condition book at the time of entry. Weight: 122 lbs. Fillies:1 19 lbs. Field will be limited to 12 starters.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AUGUST RAIN away well and stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, advanced smartly three wide upon entering the backstretch, took a narrow advantage into the final turn, and drew clear over the final furlong while under confident handling. VECTOR broke sharply and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing just out from the rail, held a stalking trip behind the battling leaders in the run down the backside, rallied two wide through the final turn, and closed willingly three wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. DIOCLES unhurried early while settling at the back of the pack entering the stretch the first time, continued to bide his time at the rear of the field entering the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, tipped off the rail leaving the turn, and closed two wide in the drive while being jostled between rivals to get up for a share. NORTHERN FORCE away alertly and stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and closed three wide in the drive while exchanging bumps with DIOCLES. WEALTHY TEXAN raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace through the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was unable to match strides with AUGUST RAIN entering the final turn, and faded in the late stages. WHISKEY HARBOR settled off the early pace while racing three wide entering the stretch the first time, dropped back to trail in the run to the final turn, rallied one out from the rail entering the turn, but failed to mount a late bid when called upon. BECKETT'S BEST tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, forced the issue two wide from between rivals in the run down the backstretch, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Diocles
ENTRY.OWNER: Wil - A - Way Farm Jewsbury Gail C and Jarvis Pat
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Vector
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked inside, rallied 2 w, closed 3w, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Beckett's Best
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: August Rain
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3w, advanced 1/2, rallied 3w, led, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Northern Force
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Wealthy Texan
ENTRY.COMMENT: led rail, rallied rail, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: Whiskey Harbor
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, trailed, rallied 2 wide, lacked response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 21000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Pric e $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VIVA LA VINO stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, launched her bid three wide entering the final turn, quickly overhauled BELCARRA PARK soon after straightening for home, and drew clear late to prove best. FREESTYLE settled off the early speed while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, commenced her bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and closed three wide in the drive to get up for the place late. BELCARRA PARK away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, opened a clear advantage in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was overtaken soon after entering the lane, and faded in the late going. ADDENDUM was unprepared at the start, while leaning in, hit the gate hard in the opening strides while almost unseating her rider, lagged well off the early pace after her early trouble entering the backstretch, rallied two wide through the final turn, and finished with late interest from along the inside in the stretch drive. NO PEOPLE broke sharply and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, chased the pacesetter two wide into the final turn, but was outfinished over the final furlong. DREAMB lagged well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but needed more when called upon. I'M ALL SHOOK UP away well and was taken in hand and allowed to settle off the early pace while saving ground at the rail, was called upon for run approaching the final turn, but failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: No People
ENTRY.OWNER: Bulldog Bros Racing and LeMasurier Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: I'm All Shook Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled inside, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Addendum
ENTRY.OWNER: Freedom Farms Ltd Tom Peter and More Rewards Syndicate
ENTRY.COMMENT: unprepared start, lagged 2w, rallied 2w, closed inside

ENTRY.NAME: Freestyle
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Dreamb
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged rail, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Viva La Vino
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Belcarra Park
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, clear lead, late fade
